Posts.title: Poison In The Pendant
Posts.preview: One day a king falls out of love with her queen because she was always in a bad mood and always getting sick. So he goes to a warlock to buy a spell or a potion to kill her so he wouldn't bother him anymore
Posts.body: Instead of a spell or a potion warlock gaves him a pendant saying it is poisoned and it only works if she wears it all the time. King takes the pendant to her queen and to make sure she wears it all the time king has to be with her all day, all night. He keeps watching her and making sure it works he keeps asking how are you feeling to her. Queen is unaware of what his agenda is keeps getting healthier and happier because she gets to have time with him. And seeing her this lively king starts falling in love with her again. So he goes back to the warlock and ask him is there any antidote for the poison in the pendant so it would not kill her. Warlock said to the king I have never put poison in that pendant, the poison was in your mind my king. I believe the queen was unhappy because he could not see you and spend more time with you. That is why I gave you chance to heal her even at the expense of you beheading my head.

Posts.title: NPM Commands For Efficiency
Posts.description: Npm commands you did not know you need.
Posts.preview: As developers we use Node Package Manager an awful lot. We also need a bunch of commands to use npm. And to work more efficiently we do need to know some key commands. Here are five commands to use for efficiency.
Posts.body:
1) Npx and the packages you can use without installing:
Npx is a tool for installing and executing packages. As developers we do need to think about pollution in long term. That is when npx comes into scene.
We can use npx to install packages. And good news is they are not installed globally. You can also run packages that is not previously installed. This is a good advantage because sometimes you just want to try out a package before installing them globally.
 Let’s try a couple:
 npx cowsay <text>
 This is what npx cowsay <text> command do. It simply does what echo command does but in a funnier way.

Posts.title: SQL && NoSQL?
Posts.description: This is not intended as a comparison between SQL and NoSQL.
Posts.preview: There are a lot of databases out there for different data structures. And I really mean an insane amount of databases.In the end they all come down to SQL and NoSQL.
Posts.body:
Most of the time we see many threads like: 
 MongoDB vs Mysql vs Cassandra vs RethinkDB vs Redis which one should I choose?  
 It goes on and on and on. And yes there are a lot of them to choose from but why use a database based on just SQL or just NoSql? Both can come in handy in different situations. They both store our data just in different forms and models. 
 SQL is more of an old soul and an old reliable that companies have been using for many years. It likes structuring and establishing relationships between your data so it looks neat and clean. 
 NoSQL on the other hand uses nothing but SQL so data can be in many different forms and NoSQL not very good at relationships, either . 
 So what is structured and non-structured actually mean in databases? I used a SQL based database for my e-commerce which was MySQL and since I used Laravel framework it was a given. And now I am using MongoDB for another project I am working on. But let’s just start with MySQL. 
 When it comes to keeping data SQL store them in tabels. We create our database starting with tables like users_tables, products_tables. 
 After that we create columns for the users table like 'name', 'surname', 'password' and for the products table 'product_name', 'product_price'.

Posts.title: How to 'Mind Map'?
Posts.description: How do I use mind maps as a programmer
Posts.preview: Brain is somewhat hard to comprehend. But we all know about memory. Memory is where we acquire, store and retrieve knowledge. And mind maps can help this process.
Posts.body:
What is memory? 
 Before we get into mind maps we need to understand how memory and memorising or learning works. Usually memory split into two categories implicit and explicit. 
 1) Implicit memory: Implicit memories form unconsciosly. It is mostly effective when we are learning motor skills like walking or riding a bike. 
 Explicit memory: You can say we are in charge of explicit memory. As it comes to explicit long-term memory we pick the things goes in there like a loved one’s birthday or passwords. 
 How do we learn? 
 There are stages between learning and making it a memory. There is a learning method called memorising by association that super-learners use. A lof of the knowledge we are trying to acquire is related to the ones we are already have even in the most loose and tenuous way. 
  Back in high school we did this thing where we put a foreign word into a sentence instead of the one we use in our language. I didn’t realise we are memorising them by assosiation. 
 Let me give you an example. Let’s say we are trying to learn French. And we just learned the word Bougie which means candle in French. 
 We can put it in a sentence like “We lit the bougies because the lights went out” and now our minds can associate the word bougie with candle. 
 We can memorise everything by just associating with things we already know. 
 Association can be made in different ways. We can make it into a mind map and put related words or ideas. 
  Mind Maps 
 You remember those scribbles we did when in class and you remember which class you did it in. If yes, then you can understand how we associate things. You can associate your drawing of a man in pain with being in Math class. And that is how mind maps works, too. 
 Let me Illustrate: 
  If I want to learn the word 'Bougie'. I need some words for association. And in this example of a mind map of the word Bugie I put Lumiere in the center since already know him and I thought Bougie is written kinda like Boogie hence my first thought was the Boogie man and Boogie man comes at night and it gets spooky so we need to turn the lights on hence the candles. 
   This is a simple mind-map with only one branch. You can add multiple branches. Let your mind wander. Normally, bougie is the center of the mind-map which is the theme. And the branches represents the new ideas. And you should use images to associate with your ideas. Be as visual as possible. 
 Mind Mapping as a Programmer 
  People usually use mind maps for coming up with new ideas, coming up with solutions for a problem, taking notes etc. As you can see you can use mind maps for basically anything. I started mind mapping method for learning new things and planning my career. Now I use it for programming, too. 
 Let’s say I am starting a new website project but I need a draft first. Before I start to draw the design I need to know where all things are gonna go so I create a mind map with multiple branches. 
  Then I carve out the details for the website I can create a sketch then start to build. 
 These types of mind maps can also come in handy when you come across a bug issue and trying to find solutions. You can put the problem in the center and brainstorm the solutions. It can help you see the issue in a whole different light.

Posts.title: The Raw Power of Command Line
Posts.preview: The command line or CLI is also called command promt in Windows OS, terminal in MacOS. Sometimes we refer to is as shell or bash,too. Although these names can be interpreted different in different kind of systems. Let’s not go so much into the terminology so as not to get confused.
Posts.body:
In general system uses either a CLI (Command line interface) or GUI (Graphical user interface) depending on the task at hand. I am going to refer to Command line interface as shell from now on.
Today GUI is getting more popular because graphical user interfaces getting more appealing, easy to learn and user-friendly than shell.
There was a time shell was more popular. Back when GUI wasn’t a thing, there were only command line. You would use to run all the commands you need and it hasn’t changed since.
The reason we still use shell because it hasn’t changed since 1960s. When you scripting or dealing with a bunch of servers you don’t want your interface to change much as it may affect your scripts.
Shell has other advantages, too. It works at a higher speed and with precision which is important for a developer like myself. Shell may look more plain and drab than a GUI but it gives you much more flexibility.
